hints.content:
The $\purpleD{\text{numerator}}$ is the number of equal parts being counted.

The $\blueD{\text{denominator}}$ is the number of equal parts in **one** whole. 

$\dfrac{\purpleD{\text{numerator}}}{\blueD{\text{denominator}}}$

The $\blueD{\text{denominator}}$ is $\blueD8$, so we need $\blueD8$ equal pieces in each whole.

The $\purpleD{\text{numerator}}$ is $\purpleD{12}$, so we need $\purpleD{12}$ equal parts shaded.

The following images show $\dfrac{12}8$ shaded:


[[☃ image 1]]


[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: Two squares. Each square is divided into 8 equal parts. Both squares have 6 parts shaded. !
Two squares. Each square is divided into 8 equal parts. The first square has 8 parts shaded. The second square has 4 parts shaded. !

question.content:
Each large square represents $1$ whole.

**Which images show $\dfrac{12}8$ shaded?**

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![Three squares. Each square is divided into 8 equal parts. Each square has 2 parts shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e34eb842709f3b6d852c9b18347c003c4c2f6815)
![Two squares. Each square is divided into 8 equal parts. Both squares have 6 parts shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6f5563eb321a0b8c97899678f7a208815b119be4)

![Two squares. Each square is divided into 8 equal parts. The first square has 8 parts shaded. The second square has 4 parts shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8d656e91425940a37bac11118db4274f7dab7643)

![Two squares. Each square is divided into 10 equal parts. The first square has 10 parts shaded. The second square has 2 parts shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ecd586509c7cc3f7d7717e4a598531ec636a5244)
